alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 8:54PM MST until July 26 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Areas near Concho and Concho Creek in Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until midnight MST. * At 853 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain around Concho. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Concho and Little Ortega Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 61 between mile markers 363 and 378. Highway 180 near mile marker 349. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Mineral Creek, Little Colorado River, Oso Draw, Concho Creek and Big Hollow Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
